questions.question_text: Which of the following process trees should raise the most suspicion that adversary activity may be present on a web server?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
W3WP.exe is the IIS worker process, which is exacted on a web server

Selected Answer: D
D
D. WININIT.EXE >> SERVICES >> SVCHOST.EXE >> W3WP.EXE >> CMD.EXE

questions.question_text: When searching for all events related to a specific process which field(s) should be selected in a query from the Event Actions drop down menu?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
C allows us to capture events where the process is both the target and the context, providing a comprehensive view of all related events.

Selected Answer: C
C
C. Both TargetProcessId_decimal and ContextProcessId_decimal

choices.D: Command Line view of a Detection

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
D. Command Line view of a Detection

questions.question_text: Your environment has several PowerShell scripts running that are Base64 encoded. Which of the following areas of Falcon will show you the decoded PowerShell commands?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
A. Investigate module

questions.question_text: Where in the Falcon console do you find hunting reports?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
Logon Activities Visibility Report:
Investigate->Windows user logon activity: PasswordAgeDays

Selected Answer: C
User Timeline provide uers last reset their password, along with other relevant user actions over a specified period

Selected Answer: C
In UI,
Investigate > User > User logon activities (Windows-only)

C. User Timeline
Answer should be C , there is no report under Visibility Report named as Logon Activities
I think answer should be C

questions.question_text: Which report would you use to find when a specific user last reset their password?
